metadata.Title: CVE-2021-36047 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
XMP Toolkit SDK version 2020.1 (and earlier) is affected by an Improper Input Validation vulnerability potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation requires user interaction in that a victim must open a crafted file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-36047` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

exempi - 2.5.2-1ubuntu0.22.04.1
libexempi8 - 2.5.2-1ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> fixed in adobe's 2021.07 code drop

criterions.comment: exempi package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.5.2-1ubuntu0.22.04.1').
